title: Relative motion - relative velocities of vehicles

content.description: Three vehicles pass each other traveling on a three-lane roadway. Vehicle <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is moving west with speed <math alttext="v sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> relative to the road; Vehicle <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is moving east with speed <math alttext="v sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> relative to the road; and Vehicle <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> is moving east with speed <math alttext="v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> relative to the road. Assume east is the positive direction. What is the velocity of Vehicle <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> relative to observers in Vehicle <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and in Vehicle <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>?
